description: Jobseekers can upload CVs on Universal Jobmatch to help them find full or part-time jobs in Great Britain and abroad.
title: Universal Jobmatch: jobseeker accounts created
description-extra: The service was introduced in November 2012.
costs:
This process is part of Jobsearch Advice service and all the costs are already included in the unit cost of Adviser Interventions (jobsearch advice) 
The costs for 2012 to 2013 included the costs of its predecessors, Employer Direct, National Email Team, Jobseeker Direct Online.
other-notes:
The volumes cover the number of new accounts created by jobseekers on the Universal Jobmatch (UJ) service. These are accounts jobseekers have created for themselves on the UJ service which will enable them to save preferred job search criteria, receive automated notifications of job vacancies matching their criteria, upload and store CVs, and enable their details to be searchable by DWP staff and employers.
This type of internal management information does not form part of the official statistics outputs that are released by the Department in accordance with the UK Statistics Authorityâ€™s Code of Practice.

modules.title: Transactions per year
info: Data source: Department for Work and Pensions

modules.title: Total cost
info:
This process is part of Jobsearch Advice service and all the costs are already included in the unit cost of Adviser Interventions (jobsearch advice) 
The costs for 2012 to 2013 included the costs of its predecessors, Employer Direct, National Email Team, Jobseeker Direct Online.
Data source: Department for Work and Pensions

Total cost is the overall cost per year of providing a service, including staff, IT and accommodation costs; the total cost is automatically calculated from volume and cost per transaction figures, and some rounding errors may occur.

modules.title: Cost per transaction
info:
This process is part of Jobsearch Advice service and all the costs are already included in the unit cost of Adviser Interventions (jobsearch advice) 
The costs for 2012 to 2013 included the costs of its predecessors, Employer Direct, National Email Team, Jobseeker Direct Online.
Data source: Department for Work and Pensions
Cost per transaction is the average cost of providing each successfully completed transaction, across all channels. Staff, IT and accommodation costs should be included.

modules.title: Transactions per quarter
modules.description: Total number of transactions each quarter
info: Data source: Department for Work and Pensions

modules.title: Digital take-up
info: Data source: Department for Work and Pensions
Digital take-up measures the percentage of completed applications that are made through a digital channel versus non-digital channels.
